channel.title: determination on Khaled Allen
channel.description: Recent content in determination on Khaled Allen

item.title: This Isn't Going to Be Easy, Is It?
item.description: Chi Ku (Eat Bitter) -Chinese proverb, meaning, "to endure hardship to attain a goal" I have been in Boulder almost a full year now, and it hasn't been easy. I came here thinking it was meant to be. I would show up, tell people that I taught natural movement, and BAM, the money would start rolling in. I would be surrounded by nature and like-minded people, be in the midst of deepening my understanding of ecopsychology, and helping others connect with nature and their bodies.

item.title: When Life Gets in the Way, What do You Do?
item.description:
Om Gam Ganapataye Namaha -Mantra to Ganesh, Remover of Obstacles

It's the day before, and you've committed to turning over a new leaf. Exercise, productivity, healthy eating, and overflowing compassion, starting tomorrow morning.

But to fit it in, you'll need to get up a bit earlier than usual. No problem, as going to bed early is part of your plan too. Off to bed at 9pm.

But then your neighbor's dog gets loose in the middle of the night and her barking keeps you up for an hour. You wake up groggy when your alarm goes off at 6am.

Life Gets in the Way.

Nevertheless, fueled by the passion of the untried, you make it out for your morning run. It's rough getting started, but once you hit your stride, your pace blows off the early morning cobwebs, and you return home invigorated and encouraged.

At work, you dive right in to your to-do's, rather than checking your e-mail, chatting with your coworkers, and adjusting your seat as usual. By 11am, you're on track to finish your required work so that you can work on that special project of your own that will get you ahead in the company.

Then, Mr. Garfield comes by with a request that you attend an "emergency meeting" right after lunch. Checking your schedule, you figure you can handle the slight delay and still stay on track if you eat at your desk. But, while you're doing that, Sarah comes by and says that she's going out of town tomorrow so she'd like to discuss that important project with you over lunch. There goes your lunch break.

item.title: An Instant Under the Bar
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1274" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Marc-Andre Casavant on Flickr"][/caption]

Yesterday, over the course of something like two hours and 15-20 failed attempts, I managed to snatch 165 lbs, which is significant because that is my bodyweight (a snatch is an Olympic weightlifting movement in which you take a bar from the ground to overhead in one motion). I had set a bodyweight snatch as a goal almost a year ago, and had gotten to 160 lbs long before, but that elusive 5 lbs seemed impossible. Yesterday, I decided I would nail it, and in the end, it was mostly this determination that made the difference, rather than any actual performance improvement.
